page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: W W The area is 50-100m above sea-level, mainly grassland and arable, and lies in a Devonian Sandstone area between the Severn Valley and the Malvern Hills. It contains parts of the villages of Redmarley d'Abitot and Bromesberrow Heath. The former name is derived from that of the Norman Lords of the Manor who came from Abitot in Normandy. Formerly a dairy farming area, in recent years there has been a change to arable. Few people work locally. In 1644 a skirmish took place between Royalists and Parliamentarians. There are two cavalry standards of that time in Bromesberrow church. There are several 18-19C mansions Pfera Hall, Drury Lane House, Haffield and Bromesberrow Court. Bury Court has a Norman vaulted cellar.
